comment.author: jsimons
comment.text:
LengthValidator.patch contains the patch to fix LengthValidator. LengthValidatorTestCase.cs contains the LengthValidator tests.
Since there is no test project for Castle.Components.Validator, I've included the cs file instead of a patch.

comment.author: andrew
comment.text: Because a field could be optional (no ValidateNonEmpty), LengthValidator only runs if a value exists. I'm looking into this part "If only a max or a min length is specified the method always returns true without evaluating any other conditions."

comment.author: jsimons
comment.text: Of course, that makes sense :) In that case, we should add a flag to the LengthValidatorAttribute that specifies if the field is Optional or not, what do u think?

comment.author: jsimons

comment.author: jsimons
comment.text:
Sorry Andrew for the influx of comments!!
After giving it a bit more thought, how about if we assume that optional parameters are null. So that if the filed is set to null than return true but if the field is an empty string than it should get evaluated?

comment.author: jsimons
comment.text: I've just submitted LengthValidator2.patch. Let me know what you think? This patch includes also the test cases.

comment.author: andrew
comment.text:
String.Empty and a null string have identical meanings for validation (though technically different). If a value does not exist (null or a zero-length String), IsValid should return true, unless it's ValidateNonEmpty.
In other words, I think we can keep everything as is for the moment :) While a shortcut might be nice, just add or omit ValidateNonEmpty. It'll be more consistent.

comment.author: jsimons
